listData.name: Overdraft
listData.description: The overdraft facility allows the borrower to have a negative balance on the current account in the respective currency. The overdraft is an on-demand credit facility, designed to be used as a flexible borrowing for general working capital requirements.

lendingRates.additionalInfo: AUD BLR rate used to price overdrafts. Any unauthorised overdrafts are charged an additional 2% above BLR rates.

detailData.name: Overdraft
detailData.description: The overdraft facility allows the borrower to have a negative balance on the current account in the respective currency. The overdraft is an on-demand credit facility, designed to be used as a flexible borrowing for general working capital requirements.

listData.name: Current Account
listData.description: HSBC's primary current offering known as a Business Cheque Account is an interest bearing account aimed at meeting Corporate's daily banking needs with the flexibility of easy access and control. This account type is of particular relevance for clients with a need to conduct ACH transactions. Customer benefits include:1)Attractive Interest Rates, 2)Online access via HSBCnet and 3) Competitive fees.

fees.name: Fee per transaction on the account
Cheque clearing charges per item
Cheque book - charge per cheque written
Inward Transfers - International Telegraphic Transfer (TT) receipt
Inward Transfers - Local RTGS receipt
Inward Transfers - Foreign currency cheques and drafts sent for collection
Inward Transfers - Foreign currency cheques and drafts purchased

detailData.name: International Cash Management Account
detailData.description: The International Cash Management Account is a At-Call account offering catering for HSBC's foreign currency account offering.

listData.name: Virtual Accounts
listData.description: HSBC offers two types of Virtual Accounts (VA): (1) Traditional VA - A unique reference number in the format of a BSB and account number that payors can use to make a payment to help Wholesale banking customers with payor identification; (2) Next Generation Virtual Account Management - A solution that can help reduce the number of physical bank accounts held by the customer and streamline bank account management and reconciliation activities

features.additionalInfo: There is no limit to the number of transactions that can be made into the virtual account

Applicable to Next Generation Virtual Account Management only. User interface is accessible through HSBCnet. Enables customer to visualise virtual account balances, self-manage certain virtual account parameters (open/close, rename virtual accounts), download virtual account reporting.

Receivables reporting Virtual account transactions are identifiable in the regular bank statement. However, a dedicated report for receipts, including receipts into a virtual account, is available as an optional feature.

fees.name: Establishment Fee - Traditional VA
fees.additionalInfo: One off establishment charge

fees.name: Maintenance fee
fees.additionalInfo: Applicable to Traditional VA and Next Generation Virtual Account Management. Monthly fee per physical account

fees.name: Transaction fee - Traditional VA
fees.additionalInfo: Fee charged for each transaction made into a virtual account. This is  charged in addition to the usual transaction fees.

fees.name: Establishment Fee - Next Generation Virtual Account Management
Maintenance fee - Next Generation Virtual Account Management
fees.additionalInfo: $1 per virtual account, subject to a minimum charge of $300. Monthly fee per virtual account. This is charged in addition to the maintenance fee for the physical account.

detailData.name: Virtual Accounts
detailData.description: HSBC offers two types of Virtual Accounts (VA): (1) Traditional VA - A unique reference number in the format of a BSB and account number that payors can use to make a payment to help Wholesale banking customers with payor identification; (2) Next Generation Virtual Account Management - A solution that can help reduce the number of physical bank accounts held by the customer and streamline bank account management and reconciliation activities

listData.name: Term Deposit Account
listData.description: Provides a fixed term investment at a specified interest rate.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Must be an existing client with a valid current account.

fees.name: N/A
fees.additionalInfo:
. If the Customer has already been paid interest at the full rate then the principal amount payable to the Customer when the Bank closes the Account will be reduced to put the Customer in the 
same position as if interest on the amount deposited had been reduced by 50% for the whole 
time the Account was open.

depositRates.additionalInfo: Please refer to your relationship manager. Above rate is applicable for 1 month. Please refer to your relationship manager as the quoted rate will vary depending on tenor, amount and client classification.

detailData.name: Term Deposit Account
detailData.description: Provides a fixed term investment at a specified interest rate.

listData.name: Encashment Authority
listData.description: Encashment Authority (ENA) is used by customers for cashing cheques at alliance bank branches for petty cash. The ENA is issued by HSBC to its alliance bank to remove the risk of a dishonoured cheque up to the limit agreed with the customer.

features.additionalInfo: Unlimited transactions up to the limit amount specified by the customer within a given frequency (e.g. daily, weekly, monthly)

constraints.additionalInfo: The cumulative amount of encashments is subject to the approved credit limit

eligibility.additionalInfo: Corporate use only. Product offering is subject to approval of credit limit.

fees.name: Cheque encashment facility - set up
fees.additionalInfo: Charged per branch

fees.name: Cheque encashment facility amendment
fees.additionalInfo: Charged per amendment per branch

fees.name: Cheque cashing fee
fees.additionalInfo: Charged for each encashment transaction. The fee is 1.5% of the transaction amount and is a minimum of AUD10 per transaction.

detailData.name: Encashment Authority
detailData.description: Encashment Authority (ENA) is used by customers for cashing cheques at alliance bank branches for petty cash. The ENA is issued by HSBC to its alliance bank to remove the risk of a dishonoured cheque up to the limit agreed with the customer.

listData.name: 31 Day Notice Account
listData.description: HSBC’s 31 Day Notice Account (31DNA) is a deposit available in AUD and USD that rewards long term behavior by paying an enhanced yield on funds held prior to notice of withdrawal. Withdrawals are subject to a notice period during which the credit interest rate applied will reflect the reducing residual term.

features.additionalInfo: Enablement to view account information over HSBCnet
Redirection of Credit Interest - Ability to direct enhanced credit interest to either the Notice account itself or to a business operating account.

depositRates.additionalInfo: Upon requesting a withdrawal of funds the client will receive a reduced amount of interest for these funds over a 31 day period.

detailData.name: 31 Day Notice Account
detailData.description: HSBC’s 31 Day Notice Account (31DNA) is a deposit available in AUD and USD that rewards long term behavior by paying an enhanced yield on funds held prior to notice of withdrawal. Withdrawals are subject to a notice period during which the credit interest rate applied will reflect the reducing residual term.

listData.name: Transaction Negotiation Authority
listData.description: Transaction Negotiation Authority (TNA) is used when a corporate customer is using a third party payroll bureau to process payroll on behalf of the client. The “TNA” is issued by HSBC to the payroll bureau’s bank to remove the risk of failed settlement by the customer up to the limit agreed with the customer.

features.additionalInfo: Transaction frequency and amount can be specified based on requirement

features.additionalValue: Notification from Relationship Manager if a transaction goes over the approved limit

constraints.additionalInfo: Maximum limit dependent on approved credit limit

eligibility.additionalInfo: Corporate customers only. Credit limit required.

fees.name: Monthly Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Monthly Fee

fees.name: Implementation fee

detailData.name: Transaction Negotiation Authority
detailData.description: Transaction Negotiation Authority (TNA) is used when a corporate customer is using a third party payroll bureau to process payroll on behalf of the client. The “TNA” is issued by HSBC to the payroll bureau’s bank to remove the risk of failed settlement by the customer up to the limit agreed with the customer.

listData.name: Term Loan
listData.description: Term Loans are loans provided at a specified sum with a specified tenor and repayment schedule, which once borrowed and repaid may not be reborrowed.

detailData.name: Term Loan
detailData.description: Term Loans are loans provided at a specified sum with a specified tenor and repayment schedule, which once borrowed and repaid may not be reborrowed.

listData.name: Revolving Loan
listData.description: Revolving Loans constitute credit lines available over a specified period of time where the loan is allowed to be drawn, repaid and re-drawn within the available limit during the term of the facility.

detailData.name: Revolving Loan
detailData.description: Revolving Loans constitute credit lines available over a specified period of time where the loan is allowed to be drawn, repaid and re-drawn within the available limit during the term of the facility.
